title: Be Specific and Clear in Your Instructions
content: The more specific and unambiguous your instructions are, the better the LLM can understand your request and generate the desired output. Instead of 'Write about dogs,' try 'Write a short, heartwarming story (around 200 words) about a loyal golden retriever who helps his elderly owner find his lost keys.'

title: Iterate and Refine Your Prompts
content: Don't expect the perfect result on your very first try. Prompt engineering is an iterative process. Start with a simpler version of your prompt, observe the output, and then gradually refine it. Small changes in wording or structure can often lead to significant improvements in the AI's response.

title: Specify the Desired Output Format
content: Clearly tell the model how you want the output to be formatted. For example: 'Provide the answer as a bulleted list,' 'Generate a JSON object with the keys: "name", "email", and "city",' or 'Write the summary in a single paragraph.' This saves you post-processing time.

title: Use Role-Playing to Set Context
content: Assigning a role to the AI can significantly shape its responses. For instance: 'Act as an expert travel guide. Recommend three off-the-beaten-path destinations in Italy suitable for a solo traveler interested in history and cuisine.' This helps the model adopt the appropriate tone, knowledge, and style.

title: Experiment with Temperature (If Available)
content: The 'temperature' parameter controls the randomness of the AI's output. For creative tasks (e.g., story writing, brainstorming), a higher temperature (e.g., 0.7-1.0) can lead to more diverse and surprising results. For factual, precise, or code-generation tasks, a lower temperature (e.g., 0.0-0.3) is usually better for consistency and accuracy.
